eecs.jago.element
Class StandardRobot

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--eecs.jago.element.SimElement
        |
        +--eecs.jago.element.VisibleElement
              |
              +--eecs.jago.element.MobileElement
                    |
                    +--eecs.jago.element.StandardRobot
All Implemented Interfaces:
Collidable, Mobile, Monitor, Realism, RobotState, java.lang.Runnable, Visible
Direct Known Subclasses:
DozerBot, LegoRobot, LegoTwoWheelRobot, PusherRobot
public class StandardRobot
extends MobileElement
implements Monitor, RobotState, Realism

Implements the methods for operating a Lego Mindstorms robot within the Jago SimBox.

This class allows a robot to be operated in both a standard (idealistic) mode and a realistic mode. Changes in realistic mode:

  • The left and right motor implement "drag"; the robot may not drive straight.
  • Because of the drag, the robot may not pivot the exact amount specified.
  • The robot does not immediately halt when colliding with an object; it will continue to try to move in the direction it was moving, according to the instruction given (i.e. goForward(1000) will attempt to move for 1000ms regardless of any contact).
  • Sensors attached to the robot return values more representative of the actual sensor (if they implement realism)

batteryPower

protected double batteryPower
The voltage reading from the robot's battery. Used in REALISTIC mode to allow functions based on the battery power

currentPowerLevel

protected double currentPowerLevel
The most recently set power level. This is equivalent to the gear on a transmission; power measures the actual output based on this gearing.

Constructor Detail

StandardRobot

public StandardRobot()
Creates an idealistic robot. This will create a robot that can have 3 sensors attached. The robot must be added to a simulation before it can be used.

public void drawTrails(boolean drawing)
If true is passed, this ArtistBot will begin leaving a trail of green dots as it moves.

Parameters:
drawing - DOCUMENT ME!

goBackward

public void goBackward()
Causes the robot to go backward. The robot will continue to travel backwards until another movement command is issued (including halt).

goBackward

public void goBackward(int milliseconds)
Causes the robot to move backward for the specified number of milliseconds or until a collision occurs, whichever occurs first, and stop.

If the time to travel is less than a simulation update cycle (which is generally > 50ms), the robot will move abnormally slow. This occurs because it does not take full advantage of a simulation cycle, and much of the time is wasted. Although it will travel the appropriate distance (1000ms = 1000 x 1ms), it will take significantly longer in the simulation.

Parameters:
milliseconds - The number of milliseconds to travel

goForward

public void goForward()
Causes the robot to go forward. The robot will continue to travel forward until another movement command is issued.

goForward

public void goForward(int milliseconds)
Causes the robot to move forward for the specified number of milliseconds or until a collision occurs, whichever occurs first, and stop.

If the time to travel is less than a simulation update cycle (which is generally > 50ms), the robot will move abnormally slow. This occurs because it does not take full advantage of a simulation cycle, and much of the time is wasted. Although it will travel the appropriate distance (1000ms = 1000 x 1ms), it will take significantly longer in the simulation.

Parameters:
milliseconds - The number of milliseconds to travel

halt

public void halt()
Stops the robot from moving, unless the robot is pivoting. If the robot is pivoting, then the robot will wait for the pivot to complete and then halt.

handleCollision

public void handleCollision(Collidable collisionElement)
Performs actions when a collision occurs. The current implementation assumes that any TOUCH sensor will react to any collision on the front of the robot, and that any light sensor will react only to reflections near the front center of the robot.

Specified by:
handleCollision in interface Collidable
Overrides:
handleCollision in class MobileElement
Parameters:
collisionElement - A collidable actor to react to

pivotLeft

public void pivotLeft(int degrees)
Turns the robot the number of specified degrees to the left. The robot will stop if it is currently moving and then pivot.

Parameters:
degrees - The number of degrees to turn.

pivotRight

public void pivotRight(int degrees)
Pivots the robot the number of specified degrees to the right. The robot will stop if it is currently moving and then pivot.

Parameters:
degrees - The number of degrees to turn.

public void updateSensors()
Updates all the sensors. This method will be called by the simulation when it requires sensors to be updated.

Specified by:
updateSensors in interface Monitor

waitFor

public void waitFor(int milliseconds)
Causes the robot to continue what it is currently doing for a specified amount of time before executing the next command.

Parameters:
milliseconds - Specifies for how long the robot will wait

setState

protected void setState(int state)
Sets the current state of the robot. It is managed in this method to ensure synchronization, and to force the robot to wait if it is pending a collision. If it is pending a collision, it will wait in this method until it is notified by the completion of collision handling (see MobileElement.pendingCollision

Parameters:
state - The new state of the robot

changeAzimuth

protected void changeAzimuth(double delta,
                             int direction)
Sets the heading of the robot to degrees, which is guaranteed to be between 0 and 360 degrees. If the method argument is greater than 360 or less than 1, then the call is ignored.

Parameters:
delta - Change the azimuth this many degrees.
direction - PIVOTING_LEFT or PIVOTING_RIGHT

haltAfter

protected void haltAfter(int milliseconds)
Causes robot to continue its last instruction until milliseconds have passed, and then it stops.

Parameters:
milliseconds - Stop after this many milliseconds

impactOfBatteryPower

protected double impactOfBatteryPower()
Determines the impact that battery power has, between idealistic and realistic mode.

Returns:
A scaling factor 0.0-1.0, where 1.0 is no impact
